column4: I'm trying to install ndiswrapper, and I'm trying to compile from source. The install file says when I run ls /lib/modules/`uname -r`/build, I need to see .config and include, but I don't have .config. How can I get it?
you might need kernel source.. is that default in ubuntu ?
I have no idea, where would I find it?
are you booted to your currently installed kernel?
yeah, I'm in Ubuntu 10.10 right now, haven't done anything special, just a regular boot
click on the little power button
does it say restart to install updates?
you do have build-essentials installed right?
I believe so, I'll try again just in case. sudo apt-get install build-essentials?
is .config supposed to be part of build-essentials or something?
i'm guessing you can't use the version in repos?
no.. i'm not sure what actually puts .config there
of ndiswrapper? nope, I was trying to use ndisgtk, but that's giving me errors finding the ndiswrapper module

so I'm trying to install ndiswrapper from source, which involved tracking down a patch to make it compatible with kernel 2.6.35, so it compiles okay, but still doesn't fix the problem, so I'm guessing I need .config
